issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) enable RM recovery
2) Run a sleep job
3) restart RM
4) kill the application
We can not find that the logs for the first attempt
fields.summary: Fix missing log files issue in rolling log aggregation.

This message was automatically generated.

Hi [~xgong], thanks for reporting the issue and delivering the fix. I can understand the problem here, however, I am concerned that if we get rid of {{containerLogAggregators.remove(container);}} when containers get finished, it could end up with too many ContainerLogAggregators threads in case an app (long running service) allocate a lot of containers. Can we think some other way to address the problem? Something like: we can upload the container log to final location of HDFS in case of rolling log aggregation case (include pattern)?

bq. Can we think some other way to address the problem? Something like: we can upload the container log to final location of HDFS in case of rolling log aggregation case (include pattern)

Yes, that makes sense. Uploaded a new patch to address your comment
